tei:elementSpec.tei:desc: This defines a Compensating Triangle Distribution.

tei:attDef.tei:desc: The higher this value the more correlated is the random number series, i.e. the more does a random value depend on its predecessors in the series.

tei:remarks.tei:p: The value of this attribute must be >=0.0. To prevent outliers in the random number output (beyond the lower and upper limit) this value should also be set >=1.0. 1.0 keeps the triangle's left and right edge at the lower and upper limit. The greater this value, the narrower is the triangle while wandering around between the limits.

tei:exemplum.tei:p: The following can be used to create plausible timing fluctuations in polyphonic music.

tei:remarks.tei:p: Compensating Triangle Distribution is a custom type of distribution. A detailed documentation will follow soon.
